•	Tactical Execution Planner Experience Technical Operations Engineering Manager Google March 2014  – Present (1 year 6 months) Mountain View, CA Product and Test Engineering Manager Google October 2012  – Present (2 years 11 months) Mountain View, CA Vice President of Engineering Ocean Optics August 2012  –  October 2012  (3 months) Dunedin, FL Director of IT Accusoft July 2011  –  June 2012  (1 year) Tampa, FL Created IT department and defined strategy for $20M small, privately held, business in the software development field. Report to VP of Technology Infrastructure/Company Founder. 
 
•	Developed IT vision and strategy, mapped company needs to actionable plan. Outlined Infrastructure debt and key areas for immediate improvement. 
 
•	Defined first-ever company IT Budget and received preliminary budget approval for $500K infrastructure upgrade including network, phones, server virtualization (VMware), NAS/SAN architecture, remote site wireless bridge connectivity, security cameras, etc. 
 
•	Designed and deployed IT infrastructure for Greenfield site to house 25 engineers. IT architecture requires no future upgrades with expansion to 200+ employees. Fast-tracked on-going 18-month building project by overseeing project management for all activities, including IT. Grand-opening 90 days after involvement. Director of IT, Architecture Jabil October 2006  –  November 2010  (4 years 2 months) Responsible for developing complete vision and release planning for all hardware and software needs of a global Fortune 500 company. Reported directly to CIO. 
 
•	Defined and set in motion multi-year plan to move Jabil away from closed-source software. Selected and implemented SaaS and Open-Source offerings to drastically lower cost of IT operations worldwide. $30M+ immediate cost savings annually. 
 
•	Analyzed and selected next generation network. Detailed investigation revealed > 70% of company network\telecom infrastructure to be obsolete. Designed replacement network to eliminate business risk. $80M global infrastructure project designed to ensure 99.999% uptime for the next 7+ years. 
 
•	Sponsored and led Google Apps replacement for Microsoft Exchange internally hosted email. Achieved $2M+ in annual savings and anytime/anywhere access for all employees. Largest Google Apps employment to date with 35,000+ mailboxes across more than 60 global sites utilizing all languages supported by Google Apps. 
 
•	Successfully integrated Apple products into a Microsoft only environment. Executive demand and TCO were primary drivers for Mac needs. Negotiated lowest Apple procurement cost on record with initial MacBook/Mini costs below enterprise netbook levels. Integrated fully with Active Directory and all other Jabil services. 
 
•	Created Mobile Products Policy and introduced support for iPhone and Android in addition to Blackberry. Solved all management and security issues with all three mobile OS platforms. Introduction of iPhone and Android reduced annual costs by over $500K due to lowered infrastructure licensing and support needs (direct to Google). 
 
•	Won customer engagements through IT implementation of key vendor technologies where appropriate. Director of Design Services Jabil December 2001  –  October 2006  (4 years 11 months) Directed Global Design services and also functioned as business sales liaison for all design capabilities. Reported directly to Global Vice President of Technical Services. 
 
•	Managed all North American design staff in FL, MI and CA. Staff included 120+ Electrical, Mechanical, CAD, Regulatory, Thermal and Industrial Design Engineers. Created Failure Analysis capabilities as dedicated group within design to support full product development. 
 
•	Performed all Business Development functions for design worldwide. Annual design funding targets of $30M were exceeded every year. In addition to providing complete design staff funding, estimated direct manufacturing output generation from design of $500M+ annually. 
 
•	Created Network and Server full product development in house design teams. Hired Senior Directors for each discipline and led teams to create EU and Asian counterparts for ‘follow the sun’ approach to rapid new product development. Currently thriving and developing products for industry heavyweights that generate manufacturing revenue in excess of $1B annually. 
 
•	Scrapped existing process documentation and completely rewrote all ISO procedures for design. Simplified product development process to streamline operations. Reduced approximately 500 procedures and forms down to 80. Reduction in timeline of >25% achieved. Manufacturing Operations Manager Jabil January 2001  –  December 2001  (1 year) Management responsibilities for Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Test Engineering, and Manufacturing organizations. Full responsibility for all engineering and manufacturing operations for a campus with monthly revenues in excess of $60M. 
 
•	Responsible for ensuring all departments met or exceeded published corporate metrics and cost center targets. Examples of metrics include the following: Scrap %, IL as % of Value Add, DL as % of Value Add, Defects Per Million Opportunities (DPMO), and First Pass Yield (FPY). 
 
•	Led Cross-Disciplinary team in the transformation to a 5S facility. Work underway to transform campus using a complete “Lean Manufacturing” methodology. 
 
•	Led Manufacturing Operations department managers in the acquisition of TL9000 and ISO14000 certifications along with successful conversion from ISO9000-1994 to ISO9000-2000 compliancy. Test Engineering Manager Jabil January 2000  –  January 2001  (1 year 1 month) Management responsibilities for Test Engineering and Test Development. Responsible for Incircuit Test, X-Ray Test, Functional Test, Environmental Stress Screening, and System Integration Test. Failure Analysis Engineers and Diagnostic Technicians rounded out the test department of ~430 individuals. 
 
•	Directly responsible for monthly cost centers totaling $1.2M, of which, $400K was dedicated to test development activities and had to be allocated directly to customer tooling accounts. 
 
•	Responsible for ensuring campus level Test Work in Process (WIP) met or exceeded corporate targets. Began the role with > 10,000 boards in WIP and left the role with ~500 in process boards. Corporate goals were set at ~1000 boards for the campus during the given period. 
 
•	Responsible for ensuring campus level Test Downtime met or exceeded corporate targets. Corporate goals were fixed at 2% of total manufacturing time. Incoming levels were 5-6% across each of the 4 facilities. As of December 2001 all facilities had levels stable at or below 1.8%. 
 
•	Built comprehensive Failure Analysis capabilities. These capabilities allowed the campus to increase Return to Vendor (RTV) and Return to Customer (RTC) levels exponentially, simultaneously decreasing plant scrap percentage levels. Functional Test Development Manager Jabil February 1998  –  January 2000  (2 years) Management responsibilities for Functional Test Development Engineers and Technicians. St. Petersburg campus staff supported worldwide test development requirements during this time period. Group initially consisted of 12 engineers and 5 technicians and grew to 25 engineers and 20 technicians. 
 
•	Directly responsible for ~$400K monthly cost center expenditures which were completely allocated to customer funded NRE. 
 
•	Managed staff and projects simultaneously for developments that consisted of custom designed mechanical hardware, electrical hardware, and software. Provided concurrent rollout of test equipment to a minimum of 4 worldwide locations. 
 
•	Largest development project managed included 120 pneumatically actuated notebook computer functional test stations. Test personnel from Guadalajara (Mexico), Livingston (Scotland), Penang (Malaysia), and St. Petersburg (FL) were managed over a 6 month period in order to deliver no less than 5 testers per week to each of the aforementioned production sites. 
 
•	Ensured accurate and timely quote delivery for each of test development’s 12 customers. Test Engineer Jabil May 1994  –  February 1998  (3 years 10 months) Develop Functional tests for telecom/datacom products 
 
•	Develop functional tests for telecom/datacom products on HP3079/79000 platform 
 
•	Develop “Hot Mock-Up” tests for above products in early prototype stages 
 
•	Work in conjunction with customer design engineers to write test specifications 
 
•	Support manufacturing environment 24/7 on all developed test platforms 
 
Develop Incircuit test programs and fixtures for single-sided and clamshell fixtures for products with up to 18000 nodes. Included programming of EEPROM’s and Boundary Scan devices 
 
•	Train technicians on how to interpret results from failing tests. Later, trained same technicians to successfully modify existing test plans and even write test plans from scratch. 
 
•	Support Incircuit tests for large computer system company (notebooks, desktops, servers and peripherals) in a 24/7 production environment across three manufacturing lines. 
 
•	Bench level diagnosis of high loop products. Subsequent technician training in order to prevent future high loop counts. Experience Director of Engineering Google March 2005  – Present (10 years 6 months) Mountain View, CA I lead Google's Geographic Imagery Infrastructure team. My group is responsible for the systems that serve imagery in Local Search, Google Maps, Google Earth, Street View, Google Maps for Mobile, and the Google Maps APIs.  
 
This includes indexing, ranking, web crawling, user contributed photo uploads, frontend and backend infrastructure, and complex machine learning pipelines. Senior Staff Engineer / Tech Lead Manager Google June 2013  –  May 2015  (2 years) Mountain View, CA Managed a team of 50 software engineers in Mountain View, Beijing, Seattle, and Zurich to build geographic imagery systems: 
 
Geographic Image Search, lead a team responsible for unifying Geographic Image Search across all Google Maps products (Google Maps, Google Earth, Google Maps for Mobile, Places API, Local Search).  
 
Street View, I lead a team responsible for developing the serving systems and launch pipelines for Google Street View. During my tenure the team realized a 300% increase in served data, and a 4x increase in user traffic while decreasing user perceived latency. In addition, the team launched innovative features like the time view in Google Maps. 
 
Panoramio, I lead a team responsible for the continued maintenance of the Panoramio photo community. 
 
Google Maps Views, I lead a team responsible for the creation of the Google Maps Views photosphere community. Staff Software Engineer / Tech Lead Manager Google September 2009  –  June 2013  (3 years 10 months) Mountain View, CA I lead a team of 17 software engineers to maintain Google's proprietary HR master data system. Lead an effort to select a new hr system to replace the proprietary system. In addition I lead a team that built a new version of Google's performance management system. Senior Software Engineer / Tech Lead Manager Google June 2007  –  September 2009  (2 years 4 months) London, United Kingdom As an engineering manager in London, UK, I was responsible for building teams and delivering products on a variety of platforms: 
 
Google Print Ads, a product to bring the efficiencies and tools related to Google's AdWords platform to the newspaper business. Lead a team of 7 engineers who worked on Campaign Planning, demographics and geographic search back ends.  
 
Google Translate for Mobile Web, as a 20% project I wrote the first mobile version of Google Translate in 2008. 
 
Google AdWords Professionals, I lead a team of 6 engineers to build a new version of Google AdWords Professionals, which was a certification platform for third party AdWords resellers.  
 
Rich Media Dynamic Ads, I lead a team of 6 engineers to design and build a system that allowed rich media advertisers to control and optimize the content of their flash creatives in a centralize content management system.
